Basketball Rules Guide

Complete guide to FIBA, NBA, NCAA, and 3x3 basketball rules

Understanding the differences between basketball rule sets is essential for players, coaches, and scorekeepers. This guide covers the major rule variations you need to know.

FIBA Rules (International)

Used in Olympics, World Cup, and most international competitions

Game Length4 quarters √ó 10 minutes = 40 minutes
Shot Clock24 seconds (reset to 14 after offensive rebound)
Three-Point Line6.75 meters (22.15 feet)
Team Fouls5 fouls per quarter triggers bonus free throws
Personal Fouls5 fouls = disqualification
Timeouts2 in first half, 3 in second half, 1 per overtime
Overtime5 minutes per overtime period

NBA Rules

Professional basketball in North America

Game Length4 quarters √ó 12 minutes = 48 minutes
Shot Clock24 seconds (reset to 14 after offensive rebound)
Three-Point Line7.24 meters (23.75 feet), 6.7m at corners
Team Fouls5 fouls per quarter triggers bonus
Personal Fouls6 fouls = disqualification
Timeouts7 timeouts per game (4 in 4th quarter max)
Overtime5 minutes, 2 timeouts per team

NCAA Rules (College Basketball)

American college basketball rules

Game Length2 halves √ó 20 minutes = 40 minutes
Shot Clock30 seconds (men), 30 seconds (women)
Three-Point Line6.75 meters (22.15 feet)
Team Fouls7 fouls = one-and-one, 10 fouls = double bonus
Personal Fouls5 fouls = disqualification
Timeouts4 timeouts (3 30-second, 1 60-second)
Overtime5 minutes per overtime period

3x3 Basketball Rules

Fast-paced half-court game, Olympic sport since 2020

Game Length10 minutes or first to 21 points
Shot Clock12 seconds
Scoring1 point inside arc, 2 points outside arc
Team Fouls7 fouls = 2 free throws, 10+ = 2 FT + possession
Personal Fouls4 fouls = disqualification
Timeouts1 timeout per team
OvertimeFirst team to score 2 points wins

Quick Comparison Table

RuleFIBANBANCAA3x3
Quarter/Half Length10 min12 min20 min (half)10 min total
Shot Clock24 sec24 sec30 sec12 sec
Fouls to Foul Out5654
3-Point Distance6.75m7.24m6.75m6.75m
Bonus Free Throws5th foul5th foul7th foul7th foul

Scorekeeper Tips

  • ‚úìAlways confirm the rule set before the game starts
  • ‚úìTrack team fouls separately for each quarter/half
  • ‚úìReset team fouls at the start of each period (except NCAA halves)
  • ‚úìAnnounce bonus status clearly to both teams
  • ‚úìKeep a running timeline of all scoring plays for disputes
